title: 114_hr1519
content: The Act titled "Recognizing Achievement in Classified School Employees Act" acknowledges the valuable services provided by classified school employees in the US, including transportation, maintenance, food service, safety, and healthcare. These employees are essential for student welfare and safety, striving for excellence in all areas of service to the education community. Exemplary classified school employees should be recognized for their outstanding contributions to quality education. The "Recognizing Achievement in Classified School Employees Act" defines a classified school employee as a public employee working in various occupational specialties from prekindergarten to higher education. The Act also references the definitions from the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 for clarity. The "Recognizing Achievement in Classified School Employees Act" establishes a recognition program for classified school employees. The "National Classified School Employee of the Year Award program" is established by the Secretary of Education to recognize and promote excellence in classified school employees who provide exemplary service to students. Each year, a classified school employee is recommended to receive the National Classified School Employee Award. A nomination process is in place with a deadline of November 1 each year. The Secretary will solicit nominations of classified school employees in public schools from various entities, including local educational agencies, school administrators, professional associations, labor organizations, and educational service agencies. The Secretary will solicit nominations of classified school employees in public schools from various entities, including local educational agencies, school administrators, professional associations, labor organizations, and educational service agencies. Each chief State school officer must submit nominations to the Secretary for individuals to receive recognition under the National Classified School Employee Award program, demonstrating excellence in work performance, school and community involvement, leadership and commitment, local support, and enhancement of classified school employees. The National Classified School Employee Award program will evaluate nominations based on various areas of superior performance, such as health and safety promotion, efficient resource use, and enhancing the image of classified school employees in the community and schools. Uniform national guidelines will be developed for selecting deserving nominees.
